name: navigate
description: Navigate to a URL, or go forward/back in browser history. If you don't have a valid tab ID, use tabs_context first to get available tabs.

url.description: The URL to navigate to. Can be provided with or without protocol (defaults to https://). Use "forward" to go forward in history or "back" to go back in history.

tabId.description: Tab ID to navigate. Must be a tab in the current group. Use tabs_context first if you don't have a valid tab ID.

name: computer
description: Use a mouse and keyboard to interact with a web browser, and take screenshots. If you don't have a valid tab ID, use tabs_context first to get available tabs.

name: read_page
description: Get an accessibility tree representation of elements on the page.

name: form_input
description: Set values in form elements using element reference ID from the read_page or find tools.

name: get_page_text
description: Extract raw text content from the page, prioritizing article content.

name: find
description: Find elements on the page using natural language.

name: tabs_context
description: Get context information about all tabs in the current tab group.

name: tabs_create
description: Creates a new empty tab in the current tab group.

name: upload_image
description: Upload a previously captured screenshot or user-uploaded image to a file input or drag & drop target.

name: read_console_messages
description: Read browser console messages (console.log, console.error, console.warn, etc.) from a specific tab.

name: read_network_requests
description: Read HTTP network requests (XHR, Fetch, documents, images, etc.) from a specific tab.

name: resize_window
description: Resize the current browser window to specified dimensions.

name: turn_answer_start
description: Call this immediately before your text response to the user for this turn.

name: javascript_tool
description: Execute JavaScript code in the context of the current page.

name: tabs_context_mcp
description: Get context information about the current MCP tab group.

name: tabs_create_mcp
description: Creates a new empty tab in the MCP tab group.
